paramInformation.label: ΔT
paramInformation.description: How much degrees should change the temperature to turn on / off the heating mode (hereinafter, ΔT), °С

paramInformation.label: ΔT calculating
paramInformation.description: Method for calculating on / off heating mode

options.label: Turning on the heating mode at room temperature, turning off at room temperature + ΔT
Turning on the heating mode at room temperature - ΔT, turning off at room temperature
Turning on the heating mode at room temperature - ½ ΔT, turning off at room temperature + ½ ΔT (default)

paramInformation.label: Relay status before receiving data or in case of failure.
paramInformation.description: No data from the standard temperature sensor for 30 seconds or external room temperature sensor for a specified time in parameter No.5.

options.label: Relay OFF (recommended for electric floor heating)

paramInformation.label: Maximum data waiting time for external room temperature sensor, sec.
paramInformation.description: After the specified time, the lack of data from the room sensor will be considered a failure.

paramInformation.label: Minimal temperature, °С
paramInformation.description: The user-set temperature cannot be lower than this value.

paramInformation.label: Maximal temperature, °С
paramInformation.description: The user-set temperature cannot be higher than this value.

paramInformation.label: Time in Turbo mode, sec
paramInformation.description: Turbo mode is used for drying floors after wet cleaning. Turbo mode will maintain the maximum temperature at a specified period of time, after that, the thermostat will switch to the user-installed operation mode.

paramInformation.label: Consider thermostat mode when turning on the Turbo mode
paramInformation.description: This parameter determines whether the turbo mode is turned on when the thermostat is turned off.

paramInformation.label: Thermostat temperature sensor type
paramInformation.description: The DAT-101 thermostat is equipped with a high-precision DSA-111 temperature sensor. If your Z-Wave network configuration is more convenient to use a remote z-wave temperature sensor - you need to change this parameter.

options.label: Poll external room temperature sensor (External sensor has to be in 2nd association group)
Waiting for data from room temperature sensor (DAT-101 has to be in corresponding assiciation group of external temp sensor)

paramInformation.label: External temperature sensor poll period, sec
The temperature change to send values to the 1st group of associations, °С
paramInformation.description: The thermostat can send data to the controller and / or other Z-Wave network devices when the temperature specified in this parameter is changed. Install this option based on your network configuration to avoid overloads.

paramInformation.label: Time interval to force data send, sec
paramInformation.description: The thermostat can send data at certain intervals, for example, every 2 minutes. The value starts to be counted from the last successful data sending.

paramInformation.label: Sending temperature to devices in the 1st group of associations after changing the relay state.

options.label: Bistable, fixed position 1 (contacts connected - ON, disconnected - OFF)
Bistable, fixed position 2 (contacts disconnected - ON, connected - OFF)
Bistable, fixed position 1 (contacts connected - ON, disconnected - OFF)
Bistable, fixed position 2 (contacts disconnected - ON, connected - OFF)

paramInformation.label: Adjustment of the temperature sensor No.1
paramInformation.description: The parameter works if sensor No.1 is a temperature sensor, in other cases the parameter is ignored.

paramInformation.label: Adjustment of the temperature sensor No.2
paramInformation.description: The parameter works if sensor No.2 is a temperature sensor, in other cases the parameter is ignored.
